about.title: About ChessBD
about.description: ChessBD is the premier platform for chess enthusiasts in Bangladesh.
about.descriptionFull: ChessBD is the premier platform for chess enthusiasts in Bangladesh. We provide a comprehensive ecosystem for organizing tournaments, tracking ratings, and building a vibrant chess community.
about.disclaimer: ChessBD is a community site and is not affiliated with Chess.com.

tournamentManagement.title: Tournament Management
tournamentManagement.description: Organize and participate in chess tournaments with automated pairings and standings.

communityDriven.title: Community Driven
communityDriven.description: Connect with chess players, track ratings, and build your chess community.

chesscomIntegration.title: Chess.com Integration
chesscomIntegration.description: Seamlessly sync your games and ratings from Chess.com to track your progress.

realTimeUpdates.title: Real-time Updates
realTimeUpdates.description: Get instant notifications about events, pairings, and game results.

gameAnalysis.title: Game Analysis
gameAnalysis.description: Advanced game analysis powered by Stockfish 17 engine to help you improve your game.

ratingSystem.title: Rating System
ratingSystem.description: Track your performance with detailed statistics and rating calculations.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.label: Our Mission
mission.paragraph1: To democratize chess in Bangladesh by providing accessible platforms for players of all skill levels to compete, learn, and grow together. We believe chess is more than a game—it's a tool for developing critical thinking, strategic planning, and building lasting connections.
mission.paragraph2: Through our platform, we aim to foster a thriving chess community where players can showcase their skills, participate in competitive tournaments, and continuously improve their game through comprehensive tracking and analytics.

step1.title: Create Account
step1.description: Sign up and verify your Chess.com username to get started

step2.title: Join Events
step2.description: Browse and register for tournaments that match your skill level

step3.title: Compete & Grow
step3.description: Play games, track your progress, and climb the leaderboards

joinCommunity.title: Join Our Community
joinCommunity.label: Join Us
joinCommunity.description: Connect with fellow chess enthusiasts, discuss strategies, get updates on tournaments, and be part of the growing ChessBD community.

policy.seoDescription: Read ChessBD's privacy policy and data protection guidelines. Learn how we protect your data and what you can expect from our platform.
policy.seoKeywords: privacy policy, data protection, data security, user privacy, data rights
policy.title: Privacy Policy & Terms
policy.subtitle: Privacy & Data Protection
policy.description: Your privacy and security are important to us. This page outlines our policies regarding data collection, usage, and your rights as a user of ChessBD.

informationWeCollect.heading: Information We Collect
informationWeCollect.text: We collect information that you provide directly to us, including your name, email address, location, and Chess.com username. We also collect data from your Chess.com profile, including your game history and ratings, to provide tournament and rating services.

howWeUseYourInformation.heading: How We Use Your Information
howWeUseYourInformation.text: We use the information we collect to: provide, maintain, and improve our services; process tournament registrations; display tournament standings and game results; verify player identities; and communicate with you about events and updates.

dataSharing.heading: Data Sharing
dataSharing.text: We do not sell your personal information. We may share your information with Chess.com as necessary to verify your account and sync game data. Your username and public profile information may be visible to other users on the platform.

dataSecurity.heading: Data Security
dataSecurity.text: We implement appropriate security measures to protect your personal information. However, no method of transmission over the Internet is 100% secure, and we cannot guarantee absolute security.

yourRights.heading: Your Rights
yourRights.text: You have the right to access, update, or delete your personal information at any time through your profile settings. You may also request a copy of your data or object to certain processing activities.

acceptanceOfTerms.heading: Acceptance of Terms
acceptanceOfTerms.text: By accessing and using ChessBD, you accept and agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree to these terms, you may not use our services.

userAccounts.heading: User Accounts
userAccounts.text: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials. You agree to provide accurate and complete information when creating your account and to update your information as necessary.

userConduct.heading: User Conduct
userConduct.text: You agree to use ChessBD only for lawful purposes and in accordance with these Terms. You agree not to: engage in any fraudulent or deceptive activity; impersonate any person or entity; interfere with or disrupt the services; or violate any applicable laws or regulations.

tournamentParticipation.heading: Tournament Participation
tournamentParticipation.text: By participating in tournaments through ChessBD, you agree to abide by the rules and regulations set forth by Chess.com and the tournament organizers. Violations may result in disqualification or account suspension.

intellectualProperty.heading: Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.text: All content on ChessBD, including but not limited to text, graphics, logos, and software, is the property of ChessBD or its licensors and is protected by copyright and other intellectual property laws.

limitationOfLiability.heading: Limitation of Liability
limitationOfLiability.text: ChessBD shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages resulting from your use of or inability to use the services.

termination.heading: Termination
termination.text: We reserve the right to suspend or terminate your account at any time, with or without cause or notice, for any violation of these Terms or for any other reason we deem necessary.

dataCollection.heading: Data Collection
dataCollection.text: We collect only the data necessary to provide our services. This includes account information, tournament participation data, and game results from Chess.com.

dataStorage.heading: Data Storage
dataStorage.text: Your data is stored securely using Firebase services. We take reasonable measures to protect your data from unauthorized access, alteration, or disclosure.

dataRetention.heading: Data Retention
dataRetention.text: We retain your personal information for as long as your account is active or as needed to provide services. You may request deletion of your account and associated data at any time.

thirdPartyServices.heading: Third-Party Services
thirdPartyServices.text: We use Chess.com APIs to fetch your game data and ratings. By using our services, you acknowledge that your data may be processed by Chess.com in accordance with their terms and privacy policy.

contact.title: Questions or Concerns?
contact.description: If you have any questions about these policies or how we handle your data, please contact us through our

terms.seoDescription: Read ChessBD's terms of service and user agreement. Learn about your rights and responsibilities when using our platform.
terms.seoKeywords: terms of service, user agreement, community guidelines, user conduct, tournament participation
terms.subtitle: Legal Information

learn.title: Learn Chess
learn.description: Master the game of chess with comprehensive learning resources, tutorials, and practice materials designed for players of all skill levels.
learn.descriptionFull: Whether you're a beginner looking to learn the basics or an advanced player seeking to refine your skills, our learning resources provide everything you need to improve your chess game.
learn.categoriesDescription: Explore our comprehensive learning categories designed to help you master chess at every level.

basics.title: Chess Basics
basics.description: Learn the fundamentals of chess including piece movement, rules, and basic strategies.

boardSetup.title: Board Setup
boardSetup.subtitle: Board Setup
boardSetup.description: The chessboard consists of 64 squares arranged in an 8×8 grid. The board is positioned so that each player has a light-colored square (white) on their bottom-right corner.

pawn.title: Pawn
pawn.description: Pawns move forward one square at a time, but capture diagonally. On their first move, they can move two squares forward. Pawns promote to any piece (except a king) when reaching the opposite end of the board.

rook.title: Rook
rook.description: Rooks move horizontally or vertically any number of squares. They are powerful pieces, especially in open positions.

knight.title: Knight
knight.description: Knights move in an L-shape: two squares in one direction and one square perpendicular. They are the only pieces that can jump over other pieces.

bishop.title: Bishop
bishop.description: Bishops move diagonally any number of squares. Each player starts with one light-squared and one dark-squared bishop.

queen.title: Queen
queen.description: The queen is the most powerful piece. It combines the movement of a rook and bishop, moving horizontally, vertically, or diagonally any number of squares.

king.title: King
king.description: The king moves one square in any direction. The king must be protected at all costs - if it is in checkmate, the game is over.

castling.title: Castling
castling.description: Castling is a special move that allows you to move your king two squares toward a rook and then move that rook to the square next to the king. Conditions: neither piece has moved, no pieces between them, king not in check, and king doesn't pass through or end in check.

enPassant.title: En Passant
enPassant.description: If a pawn moves two squares from its starting position and lands beside an opponent's pawn, the opponent can capture it 'en passant' as if it had only moved one square.

promotion.title: Pawn Promotion
promotion.description: When a pawn reaches the opposite end of the board, it must be promoted to a queen, rook, bishop, or knight. Most players choose a queen as it's the most powerful piece.

check.title: Check
check.description: When your king is under attack by an opponent's piece, you are in check. You must get out of check on your next move by moving the king, blocking the attack, or capturing the attacking piece.

checkmate.title: Checkmate
checkmate.description: Checkmate occurs when the king is in check and there is no legal move to get out of check. The game ends immediately, and the player in checkmate loses.

stalemate.title: Stalemate
stalemate.description: Stalemate occurs when a player has no legal moves but is not in check. This results in a draw, regardless of material advantage.

drawConditions.title: Draw Conditions
drawConditions.subtitle: Draw Conditions
drawConditions.insufficientMaterial: Insufficient Material - Neither player has enough pieces to checkmate (e.g., king vs. king, king and bishop vs. king).
drawConditions.threefoldRepetition: Threefold Repetition - The same position occurs three times with the same player to move.
drawConditions.fiftyMoveRule: Fifty-Move Rule - Fifty moves have been made without a pawn move or capture.
drawConditions.stalemate: Stalemate - A player has no legal moves but is not in check.
drawConditions.agreement: Mutual Agreement - Both players agree to a draw.

controlCenter.title: Control the Center
controlCenter.description: The center squares (e4, e5, d4, d5) are the most important. Controlling them gives your pieces more mobility and options.

developPieces.title: Develop Your Pieces
developPieces.description: Get your knights and bishops into the game early. Don't move the same piece multiple times in the opening.

castleEarly.title: Castle Early
castleEarly.description: Castling protects your king and connects your rooks. It's usually best to castle within the first 10 moves.

dontMoveQueenEarly.title: Don't Move Your Queen Too Early
dontMoveQueenEarly.description: The queen is powerful but can be easily attacked. Develop your minor pieces (knights and bishops) first.

dontMovePawns.title: Don't Move Too Many Pawns
dontMovePawns.description: Moving too many pawns weakens your position and wastes time. Focus on piece development.

tactics.title: Tactics & Patterns
tactics.description: Master common tactical patterns, combinations, and tactical motifs to improve your calculation skills.

commonTactics.title: Common Tactical Patterns
commonTactics.subtitle: Tactical Patterns
commonTactics.description: Learn the fundamental tactical patterns that appear frequently in chess games.

fork.title: Fork
fork.description: A fork occurs when one piece attacks two or more enemy pieces simultaneously, forcing the opponent to lose material.

pin.title: Pin
pin.description: A pin occurs when a piece cannot move without exposing a more valuable piece behind it to capture.

skewer.title: Skewer
skewer.description: A skewer is similar to a pin, but the more valuable piece is in front and must move, exposing the less valuable piece behind.

discoveredAttack.title: Discovered Attack
discoveredAttack.description: A discovered attack happens when moving one piece reveals an attack by another piece behind it.

deflection.title: Deflection
deflection.description: Deflection is a tactic that forces an opponent's piece to leave a square, rank, file, or diagonal.

decoy.title: Decoy
decoy.description: A decoy is a tactic that lures an opponent's piece to a particular square where it becomes vulnerable.

puzzles.title: Chess Puzzles
puzzles.description: Solve chess puzzles from Chess.com to improve your tactical skills and pattern recognition.

openings.title: Opening Theory
openings.description: Explore popular chess openings, their variations, and strategic ideas behind each opening system.

openingPrinciples.title: Opening Principles
openingPrinciples.subtitle: Opening Principles
openingPrinciples.description: Follow these fundamental principles to start your games on the right foot.

controlCenter.title: Control the Center
controlCenter.description: Control the central squares (e4, e5, d4, d5) with pawns and pieces to gain space and mobility.

developPieces.title: Develop Your Pieces
developPieces.description: Bring your knights and bishops into the game quickly, preferably toward the center.

castleEarly.title: Castle Early
castleEarly.description: Castle your king to safety as soon as possible, usually within the first 10 moves.

popularOpenings.title: Popular Openings
popularOpenings.subtitle: Popular Openings
popularOpenings.description: Explore some of the most commonly played opening systems.

italianGame.title: Italian Game
italianGame.description: A classical opening focusing on rapid development and control of the center.

sicilianDefense.title: Sicilian Defense
sicilianDefense.description: The most popular response to 1.e4, creating an asymmetrical position with dynamic play.

queensGambit.title: Queen's Gambit
queensGambit.description: A solid opening system starting with 1.d4, offering strategic complexity and long-term advantages.

endgames.title: Endgame Studies
endgames.description: Learn essential endgame techniques, checkmating patterns, and positional principles.

basicEndgames.title: Basic Endgames
basicEndgames.subtitle: Basic Endgames
basicEndgames.description: Master these fundamental endgame positions to convert advantages into victories.

kingAndPawn.title: King and Pawn Endgames
kingAndPawn.description: Learn how to promote pawns and use your king effectively in pawn endgames.

rookEndgames.title: Rook Endgames
rookEndgames.description: Rook endgames are the most common in chess. Master basic techniques like the Lucena and Philidor positions.

queenEndgames.title: Queen Endgames
queenEndgames.description: Learn how to checkmate with a queen and how to avoid stalemate traps.

checkmatingPatterns.title: Checkmating Patterns
checkmatingPatterns.subtitle: Checkmating Patterns
checkmatingPatterns.description: Recognize common checkmating patterns to finish games efficiently.

backRankMate.title: Back Rank Mate
backRankMate.description: A common checkmate pattern where the king is trapped on the back rank by its own pieces.

smotheredMate.title: Smothered Mate
smotheredMate.description: A checkmate delivered by a knight where the king is surrounded by its own pieces.

strategy.title: Strategic Play
strategy.description: Understand positional concepts, pawn structures, and long-term planning in chess.

positionalConcepts.title: Positional Concepts
positionalConcepts.subtitle: Positional Concepts
positionalConcepts.description: Master these fundamental strategic ideas to improve your positional understanding.

pawnStructure.title: Pawn Structure
pawnStructure.description: Understand how pawn formations affect piece placement and long-term plans.

weakSquares.title: Weak Squares
weakSquares.description: Identify and exploit weak squares in your opponent's position.

pieceActivity.title: Piece Activity
pieceActivity.description: Keep your pieces active and coordinated. Active pieces are more valuable than passive ones.

spaceAdvantage.title: Space Advantage
spaceAdvantage.description: Control more squares on the board to restrict your opponent's options and create attacking chances.

pawnMajority.title: Pawn Majority
pawnMajority.description: A pawn majority on one side of the board can create a passed pawn and winning chances.

analysis.title: Game Analysis
analysis.description: Learn how to analyze your games, identify mistakes, and develop your chess thinking process.

resources.title: Learning Resources
resources.description: Access a variety of learning materials to help you improve

learn.stayTuned: Stay tuned for comprehensive chess learning resources!
learn.comingSoonDescription: We're working on bringing you this content. Check back soon!

comingSoonDetails.videos: Learn chess through comprehensive video tutorials covering everything from basic rules to advanced strategies.
comingSoonDetails.lessons: Engage with interactive chess lessons designed to build your understanding and improve your skills step by step.
comingSoonDetails.books: Discover the best chess books recommended by experts and top players to deepen your knowledge.

footer.description: Empowering Bangladeshi chess players with modern training tools, verified leaderboards, and inclusive events.
footer.copyright: © {{year}} ChessBD. Crafted in Bangladesh with inspiration from the global chess family.

analysis.title: Game Analysis
analysis.subtitle: Analyze your chess games with Stockfish 17
analysis.signInMessage: You need to be signed in to use the game analysis feature. Please sign in to analyze your chess games with Stockfish 17.
analysis.dragDrop: Drag and drop a PGN file here, or click to browse
analysis.getStartedDescription: Upload a PGN file or paste your game notation to analyze it with Stockfish 17. The analysis will provide:
analysis.feature3: Interactive board to review the game
analysis.getStartedInstructions: Simply drag and drop a .pgn file or paste your PGN notation in the text area above.

practiceGames.title: Practice Games
practiceGames.description: Play against a chess engine to improve your skills and practice different positions.

arena.title: Arena
arena.subtitle: Competitive Play
arena.description: Join competitive arena tournaments and compete against players from across Bangladesh. Test your skills in fast-paced matches and climb the leaderboard.
arena.signInMessage: You need to be signed in to participate in arena tournaments. Please sign in to continue.
arena.comingSoonDescription: We're working on bringing you exciting arena tournaments where you can compete in real-time matches against players from across Bangladesh. Stay tuned for updates!
arena.feature1Description: Play against live opponents in fast-paced arena tournaments
arena.feature2Description: Join quick blitz and rapid tournaments with various time controls
arena.feature3Description: Compete for top positions and track your progress on the arena leaderboard
arena.feature4Description: Participate in weekly and monthly arena tournaments with prizes
arena.joinDescription: Join competitive matches and test your skills against players and bots from across Bangladesh.
arena.enterDescription: Enter the arena and find your next opponent.
arena.arenaFullDescription: The arena has reached its maximum capacity of 50 players. Please try again later.
arena.noRankingsYet: No rankings yet. Play games to appear on the leaderboard!
arena.noStatsYet: No stats yet. Play games to see your statistics!
arena.noPlayersAvailable: No other players in arena. Waiting for opponents...
arena.playFirstMoveIn20Seconds: Please play your first move within
arena.orGameWillBeAborted: or the game will be aborted.

bots.title: Chess Bots
bots.description: Play against advanced chess engines and AI bots to improve your skills and challenge yourself.
bots.signInMessage: You need to be signed in to play against bots. Please sign in to continue.
bots.emptyMessage: There are currently no active bots available. Please check back later.

sami.description: A strong chess engine powered by advanced AI. Perfect for improving your tactical skills.

stockfish.description: The world's strongest open-source chess engine. Challenge yourself against the best.

hasuapa.name: Hasu Apa
hasuapa.description: Hasu Apa is a dramatic chess bot with full apa authority. She'll roast your blunders with shady Banglish one-liners, file imaginary inquiries into your moves, and still play solid, exam-style chess. Challenge her if you're ready for both sharp tactics and spicy commentary.

rickshawwalamama.name: Rickshawwala Mama
rickshawwalamama.description: Rickshawwala Mama weaves through the board like Dhaka traffic. Expect zigzag attacks, cheeky shortcuts, and sudden tactical turns that feel like wrong-way entries on a one-way road. If you leave a file open, he'll treat it like a VIP lane straight to your king.

padmabridge.name: Padma Bridge
padmabridge.description: Padma Bridge is a slow, powerful positional grinder. She builds rock-solid structures, connects her pieces like pillars, and slowly squeezes your position until there's no way back. Great if you want to practice long games, patience, and serious endgame technique.

murgichor.name: Murgi Chor
murgichor.description: Murgi Chor lives to steal hanging pieces. One loose knight, one unprotected bishop, and it's instantly added to tonight's biryani. He plays tricky, tactical chess with plenty of cheapos—perfect if you want to train your piece safety and blunder-spotting skills.

jhalmuriwala.name: Jhalmuri Wala
jhalmuriwala.description: Jhalmuri Wala mixes positions the way he mixes muri—everything thrown together into a spicy tactical mess. Open lines, sacs, forks, and double attacks are his favorite ingredients. Great for players who enjoy chaos and want to sharpen their calculation under fire.

pocketmar.name: Pocket Mar
pocketmar.description: Pocket Mar doesn't always go for mate right away—he quietly pockets small advantages instead. A pawn here, an exchange there, and suddenly your position is broke. He's perfect if you want to practice avoiding small inaccuracies and understanding accumulation of advantage.

bots.botNotFoundMessage: The bot you're looking for doesn't exist.
bots.challengeDescription: Test your skills against this formidable opponent. Every move counts, and {{name}} won't hold back!

info.subtitle: About Chess Bots
info.title: Improve Your Game
info.description: Playing against chess bots is an excellent way to improve your skills. Our bots use advanced AI and chess engines to provide challenging opponents at various skill levels.

locations.title: Locations
locations.subtitle: Explore Chess Communities
locations.description: Discover chess communities across Bangladesh organized by district. View player statistics, top players, clubs, and achievements for each location.
locations.districtNotFoundDesc: The district you are looking for does not exist.
locations.topPlayersDesc: Top rated players from this district
locations.noPlayersDesc: No players have registered from this district yet.
locations.noClubsDesc: No clubs have been registered in this district yet.

funFact.Cox's Bazar: Home to the world's longest natural sea beach

funFact.Meherpur: Historical significance as birthplace of Bangladesh
funFact.Munshiganj: Riverine district with historical and cultural sites

funFact.Narsingdi: Known for handloom industry and textile manufacturing
funFact.Natore: Known for cultural heritage and agricultural products
funFact.Nilphamari: Northern district known for agriculture and tea gardens
funFact.Panchagarh: Northernmost district known for tea gardens
funFact.Patuakhali: Coastal district with fishing and agriculture
funFact.Rajshahi: Famous for silk production and mangoes
funFact.Rangamati: Hill district with stunning lakes and natural beauty

funFact.Sunamganj: Known for haor wetlands and natural beauty

funFact.Thakurgaon: Northern district known for agriculture and cultural sites

unsubscribe.seoDescription: Manage your email preferences and unsubscribe from ChessBD emails.
unsubscribe.title: Unsubscribe from Emails
unsubscribe.description: We're sorry to see you go. You can unsubscribe from all ChessBD emails below.

unsubscribe.successMessage: You will no longer receive emails from ChessBD. We're sorry to see you go!
unsubscribe.alreadyUnsubscribed: This email is already unsubscribed from ChessBD emails.
unsubscribe.alreadyUnsubscribedMessage: You are currently unsubscribed from ChessBD emails. Would you like to resubscribe to receive updates, tournament notifications, and weekly digests?

unsubscribe.resubscribeSuccess: You have been successfully resubscribed to ChessBD emails.
unsubscribe.error: An error occurred while processing your request. Please try again later.
unsubscribe.errorMessage: We couldn't process your unsubscribe request. Please try again or contact support.
unsubscribe.infoDescription: If you're having trouble unsubscribing or have questions, please contact us through our Discord server or Chess.com club.

clubs.title: Chess Clubs
clubs.subtitle: Chess Communities

clubs.noClubsDescription: Clubs will appear here when they become available. Check back soon!

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.subtitle: Get in Touch
contact.description: Have questions, feedback, or need support? We're here to help! Join our community channels or reach out through our platforms.
contact.discordDescription: Join our Discord community for real-time discussions, support, and updates.
contact.chesscomDescription: Join our Chess.com club to participate in tournaments and connect with players.
contact.lichessDescription: Join our Lichess team to play and compete with the ChessBD community.
contact.emailDescription: Send us an email for direct support, inquiries, or feedback.
contact.supportDescription: The best way to get support is through our Discord server where our community and moderators are active. You can also join our Chess.com club or Lichess team to connect with other players and participate in tournaments. For direct inquiries, you can email us at support@chessbd.app.

jobs.title: Jobs & Volunteer Opportunities
jobs.subtitle: Join Our Team
jobs.description: Join ChessBD as a volunteer or team member. Help us grow Bangladesh's chess community through various roles in community engagement, content creation, events, and technology.
jobs.heroDescription: ChessBD is a nonprofit organization dedicated to growing the chess community in Bangladesh. Join us in our mission to promote chess, support players, and build a vibrant chess culture.
jobs.openPositionsDescription: We're always looking for passionate individuals to join our team. All positions are currently volunteer-based.
jobs.noOpenPositionsDescription: We don't have any open positions at the moment. Check back soon or reach out to us if you're interested in volunteering!
jobs.errorDescription: Failed to load job positions. Please try again later.
jobs.dontSeeMatchDescription: We're always open to hearing from passionate individuals who want to contribute to the chess community. If you have skills or ideas that could help ChessBD, we'd love to hear from you!

notFound.heading: Page Not Found
notFound.message: Sorry, we couldn't find the page you're looking for. It may have been moved, deleted, or the URL might be incorrect.
